meanings.definition: To create or write music or literary work.
meanings.sent1: I will compose a song for the school play.
meanings.sent2: She likes to compose poems in her free time.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to compose a meow symphony.
meanings.sent4: Her words compose a beautiful melody in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes compose a vivid painting of the sunset.

meanings.sent1: Let's compose a puzzle with all the pieces.
meanings.sent2: The team will compose a plan for the project.
meanings.sent3: The children tried to compose a robot out of cardboard boxes.
meanings.sent4: The ingredients will compose a delicious cake when mixed together.
meanings.sent5: The colors compose a stunning mosaic on the wall.

meanings.sent1: Each color will compose the final image.
meanings.sent2: The different elements compose the whole structure.
meanings.sent3: The toys compose a fun collection in the playroom.
meanings.sent4: His actions compose the true essence of his character.
meanings.sent5: The stars compose a breathtaking view in the night sky.
